column4: after upgrading to feisty I can't mount ntfs drives anymore, can anyone help please (they used to automatically mount without any problem)
FUSE installed? ntfs-3g installed?
I used to have ntfs-3g installed, will it be disabled or still installed, how can I tell?
I have this in my /etc/fstab :  /dev/hdb1 /media/hdb1 ntfs-3g auto,gid=1001,umask=0002 0 1
$ sudo mount /media/hdb1/   would give me : Failed to access '/dev/hdb1': No such file or directory ... which I found strange
- is /media/hdb1 created?
yes.. but effectively I can't find /dev/hdb1 anymore ...
- what happens if you do a 'fdisk -l' do you see /dev/hdb1?
intresting... it seems weird... everything that used to be sda is now sdb... and I can't see hdb
there you go.
where did my /dev/hdb drive go?
how can I tell what's it's new name?
try mounting one of them
one of them? them who?
try any of them
ok the sdb ones mounts fine now... but there is still my hdb that I need and I can't find
check hdb's physical connections
are you sure sdb isn't your former hdb?
it's inside my computer ... what would the physical connection be lost after an upgrade to Feisty, ... my former sda is my current sdb (this is the SATA drive) ... I still can't find my former hdb?
it's inside my computer ... why would the physical connection be lost after an upgrade to Feisty, ... my former sda is my current sdb (this is the SATA drive) ... I still can't find my former hdb?
from which drive are you booting?
ok.. I found out what's the new name of the disk: /dev/sdb1 instead of /dev/hdb1 ... tx
